#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=West Bali
#Text=West
#Text=Bali
#Text=is in Bali , Indonesia .
#Text=Cities
#Text=— the westernmost town in Bali and the ferry to Java
#Text=— capital town of Jembrana Regency , bull racing and Pura Rumbut Siwi
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=— surfing and a touch of old Bali fishing village life
#Text=Menjangan Island — small island off the north west coast with great diving and part of the West Bali National Park
#Text=— great diving and beaches with a stunning backdrop of the western mountains
#Text=— trekking , birdwatching and diverse marine life
#Text=Understand
#Text=This is the least populated and least visited region of Bali .
#Text=It is dominated by the West Bali National Park and a huge area of protected reserve , much of which is completely uninhabited .
#Text=Both the north and south coasts of this region offer quiet beaches but of a very different nature .
#Text=Those in the north fringe calm seas which are excellent for diving and snorkelling .
#Text=The southern beaches are wilder and include a number of renowned surfing spots .
#Text=The town of Gilimanuk on the very westernmost tip of Bali is the departure point for ferries to Java .
#Text=By car
#Text=Two major roads lead into West Bali , one on the north coast and one on the south coast .
#Text=The northern route links Lovina and Singaraja in North Bali to Pemuteran .
#Text=This is a relatively quiet road which offers some great scenery and attractions en-route and visitors are advised to take it slowly .
#Text=Much busier is the southern route as this carries the bulk of the commercial traffic to and from Java .
#Text=This road links South Bali to Tabanan in Central Bali and then to the western region towns of Negara and Gilimanuk .
#Text=A car journey from South Bali all the way to Gilimanuk will take upwards of 3 hours .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Scheduled shuttle buses run from many of Bali 's main visitor centres to Gilimanuk and these are widely advertised in towns such as Kuta , Lovina , Sanur and Ubud .
#Text=Check locally and book one day in advance .
#Text=Bemos servicing Negara , Gilimanuk and other parts of the south coast leave from Ubung terminal in Denpasar and Pesiapan terminal in Tabanan .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Ferries run from Ketapang ferry terminal , Banyuwangi , East Java to Gilimanuk every 30 minutes , 24 hours a day .
#Text=The journey itself takes about 45 minutes but loading and unloading may extend that time considerably .
#Text=Since Bali has been the subject of terrorist interest from Java security has tightened enormously - be prepared for delays .
#Text=Get around
#Text=This remote region of Bali lends itself to getting around by hire car or motorcycle .
#Text=Cars for rent are not all common here so best to bring it in with you from one of the main tourist destinations .
#Text=You will find motorbikes easier to come by , especially in the beach communities of Pemuteran and Medewi Beach .
#Text=See
#Text=West Bali National Park covers some 770 square kilometres and is the dominant feature of this region .
#Text=All visitors should check in and purchase permits ( Rp 25,000 ) at the main park ofice in the village of Cekik south of Gilimanuk .
#Text=Visitors intending to visit only Menjangan Island ( part of the national park ) , please see below .
#Text=For treks through forest and into the hills of the national park , proceed to the ranger station at Sumber Klampok about 20 minutes west from Cekik .
#Text=A guide is mandatory and will cost between Rp 200,000 and Rp 500,000 depending on the length and nature of your trek .
#Text=Discuss all of this and make plans with the staff at the Cekik park office .
#Text=If you are very lucky you might get to see a Bali Starling , Bali 's only endemic vertebrate species .
#Text=Vibrant marine life .
#Text=Uninhabited Menjangan Island is a renowned diving and snorkelling destination .
#Text=This is part of West Bali National Park and boats with a guide can be chartered at Labuan Lalang just to the west of Pemuteran on the north coast .
#Text=Dive operators in Pemuteran can arrange everything for you as well as other dive trips along this very attractive stretch of coastline .
#Text=If the water does to appeal so much , then you can walk around in the island in about one hour and there are lots of good photo opportunities .
#Text=Remote black sand beaches .
#Text=The south coast of this region is fringed by black sand beaches and fishing villages that attract few visitors .
#Text=The most well known of those is Medewi Beach .
#Text=This is a surf destination but also a great place to experience laid back life in a tiny Balinese fishing village .
#Text=Just relax and do not expect to see too many other visitors .
#Text=On the north coast at Pemuteran there is a more developed but still very relaxed beach scene which centres on diving , snorkelling and marine conservation .
#Text=Lots of accommodation options here to suit all budgets .
#Text=Buffalo racing ( Mekepung ) in Delod Berawah about 9 km east of Negara town .
#Text=Thought to originate in Madura , Java , the buffalo races were originally held as part of the harvest festivities in Negara .
#Text=The colorfully decorated carts and buffaloes race on a four km course every 2nd and 4th Sunday morning starting at 7.00 AM .
#Text=Rambut Siwi Temple ( Pura Rambut Siwi ) .
#Text=About equidistant between Negara and Medewi Beach .
#Text=Located on a low cliff top overlooking a breathtaking panorama of paddy fields and the mountains of West Bali National Park on one side and black sand beaches on the other .
#Text=The temple itself was built by the 16th century Javanese sage Dang Hyang Nirartha , also the creator of Tanah Lot temple .
#Text=According to legend , he made a gift of his hair to the temple .
#Text=Hence the name Rambut Siwi , which literally means ”
#Text=Hair Worship ” .
#Text=Do
#Text=Trekking and birdwatching in West Bali National Park are key activities in this region .
#Text=You might , just might , even get to see a Bali Starling , one of the rarest birds in the world with just a handful left in the wild .
#Text=Surfing is top class on the south coast beaches with the regional surf scene is being centred at Medewi Beach .
#Text=Diving and snorkeling around Pemuteran and Menjangan Island rates up there with the very best in Bali .
#Text=At the same time , get to learn about marine conservation initiatives for which Pemuteran is a key centre in the whole of Indonesia .
